REST API main¶

REST API database Db¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

Module for direct operations, adding, getting, updating, changing and deleting contacts inside the database

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the json body of the request to the function

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object that was created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.find_contacts(db: Session, user: User, firstname: str = None, lastname: str = None, email: str = None) → List[Contact]¶
The find_contacts function is used to search for contacts in the database.

The function takes a user object, and optional firstname, lastname, and email parameters. If any of these are provided they will be used as filters on the query.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Identify the user who is making the request

  • firstname – str: Filter the contacts by firstname

  • lastname – str: Search for a contact by lastname

  • email – str: Search for a contact by email

:param : Filter the contacts by firstname, lastname and email :return: A list of contacts :doc-author: Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthdays(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶
The get_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next 7 days.
Args:

user (User): The user object for which we want to get the nearest birthdays. db (Session): A database session object that is used to query the database.

Parameters:

  • user:User – Get the user id of the current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts who have birthdays in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session) → Contact¶
The get_contact function returns a contact from the database.
Args:

user (User): The user who owns the contact. contact_id (int): The id of the desired Contact object. db (Session): A database session to use for querying data from the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user from the database

  • contact_id – int: Filter the database query

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(user: User, skip: int, limit: int, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user_id of the logged in user

  • skip – int: Skip a certain number of contacts in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session) → Contact | None¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

user (User): The user who owns the contact to be removed. contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. db (Session): A connection to our database, used for querying and deleting contacts.

Returns:

Contact | None: If successful, returns a Contact object representing the deleted record; otherwise returns None.

Parameters:

  • user:User – Specify the user that is logged in

  • contact_id – int: Specify which contact to delete

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact object that was deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(user: User, contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, db: Session) → Contact | None¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

user (User): The user who is making the request. contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be updated. body (ContactUpdate): A ContactUpdate object containing all fields that can be updated for a given Contact object, including firstname, lastname, phone_number, email and date_of_birth.

Note: relationships cannot be changed via this function; use add/remove relationship functions instead!

Returns:

None if no such contact exists or

Parameters:

  • user:User – Get the user id from the database

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact that is being updated

  • body – ContactUpdate: Pass in the data that will be used to update the contact

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

A contact or none

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

Module for user’s direct operations getting, creating, authorization and authentication

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function sets the confirmed field of a user to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email address of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

None, but the type hint says it returns none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object containing the information to be added to the database. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy Session object used for querying and modifying data in the database.

Returns:

User: A User object representing a newly created user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Create a new user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, then returns the user with that email.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email address of the user to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object which is the first result of a query where the email matches

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Args:

email (str): The email address of the user to update. url (str): The URL for the new avatar image. db (Session, optional): A database session object to use instead of creating one locally. Defaults to None. # noQA: E501 line too long, but this is an example! # noQA: E501 line too long, but this is an example! # noQA: E501 line too long, but this is an example! # noQ

Parameters:

  • email – Get the user from the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is being passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Set the refresh token for a user

  • db – Session: Commit the changes to the database

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent
